main event: One red egg-shaped object was observed moving to the west in Tehachapi, California for 22 minutes on October 17, 1956.
interesting points: The object was initially sighted directly overhead at 1000 feet altitude., The object was viewed visually for an extended period of 22 minutes., The sighting included a bobbing motion and a slow descent., The report concludes that the sighting was probably caused by a balloon., The observation took place in clear conditions with a bright moon.
